item.title: Python and R
item.description: Python Communicating With R Hereâ€™s some ways that R and python can communicate. Variables defined in python can be displayed in a ggplot using R. import numpy as np x=np.random.normal(0,1,50) y=np.random.normal(0,1,50) library(reticulate) library(ggplot2) ggplot()+geom_point(aes(py$x,py$y)) + xlab("x") + ylab("y") + ggtitle("Random Scatterplot") Another Example Python and R can communicate with each other using Reticulate. Python can access R-defined objects using r. library(reticulate) place <- "Capetown," place="South Africa" print(r.place,place) ## Capetown, South Africa This can be done the other way as well.
